question.title: {"sections": [{"spans": [{"text": "Why don't Trump supporters feel sold out by the President when after saying \"We're going to march down to the Capitol, and I'm going to march with you!\" Trump went back inside the White House and watched the violence unfold on television?", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}]}

answer.content: {"sections": [{"spans": [{"text": "Because it is not about Trump. It is never about Trump.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "It is about the anger, fear, and resentment from the people who felt that they\u2019re being wronged and ignored.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Trump is not a leader, Trump and his cohort (the republican house representatives and senators, and the conservative media) are enablers.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Trump didn\u2019t create anything new. The rage and contempt were already there. Trump simply told them \u201cIt\u2019s OK to let it out\u201d. And our system (politicians and police force) told them \u201cthere won\u2019t be any consequences\u201d.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "That\u2019s why these people praised Trump for \u201ctelling it as it is\u201d. Because it means they get to express their racism and bigotry freely without consequences. That\u2019s why it doesn\u2019t matter what Trump did, doesn\u2019t matter how outrageous it was, these people do not care.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "I\u2019m willing to go even further to say that Trump supporters didn\u2019t care about Trump as a person. They care about what Trump and his cohort allows them to do. If tomorrow Trump has a stroke and dies, these people will promote the same hatred and violence fueled by their anger and fear.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "So no.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "The problem isn\u2019t Trump. The problem is our system, and how it lets people like Trump get away with things. It is our system that, through racism in education, racism in our culture, created generation after generation of people who believe in an \u201cus vs them\u201d mentality, who believes in \u201cwealth = virtue\u201d and who worship wealthy people\u2026", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "So no. These people won\u2019t feel like they\u2019re being \u201csold out\u201d by Trump. Trump has become more and more irrelevant. Soon they\u2019ll find some other racist asshat to worship. What really scary is when they find a machiavellian smart asshat to worship. Someone who is at good as flaming hatred as Trump, and someone with an actual agenda, and an actual ideology, someone who is smart and determined enough to do something with that hate.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Then we\u2019d be screwed.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}]}
